result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Michael Senske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to continue with current payment plan.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Benjamin Michael Senske appeared. Case called at 11:15 am. Counts #2, #3 and #4. Atty Perrin recites agreement. No objection from ADA Kelly.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Counts #2, #3 and #4. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Counts #2, #3 and #4. Court dimisses Counts #1, #5, #6 and #7. ADA Kelly makes sentencing arguments. Atty Perrin makes sentencing arguments. Court orders - 2 yrs probation w/h 
On Count #2 - 90 Days i/s 
On Counts #3 and #4 - 60 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs
- Restitution to be determined. 
- DNA Surcharge (1) ; Apply Bond
- AODA
- Domestic Abuse Assessment
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No contact with M. Hammer
- Restorative Justice 
- Sign up for probation by 1:00 pm on 1/18/2017
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Counts to run concurrent to each other and 16CM644.
Court will not set any more Probation Review Hearings.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Benjamin Michael Senske appeared. Includes STC on 15CF528, SEH on 15CM644 and PAYH on 15CM414. - Domestic Abuse Assessment
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by agent
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No Contact with Marlo H. 
- Victim Empathy Seminar
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Defendant remanded to custody of Sheriff.  Probation review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 04:45 pm.

Per Defendant's bond. eif
Status conference at 08-03-2015 04:30 pm

Bond on file

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Marlo H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.


Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
